China coal mine accident kills at least 10, prompts safety checksAt least 10 people have died and six are missing after a coal mine accident in the city of Pingdingshan, in central China, the local emergency management agency said on Saturday, vowing to continue rescue operations and launch city-wide safety checks. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 08:41:11 GMT VFPMGYNH3RNNRGD7PWQYYF6K5Q https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-coal-mine-accident-kills-least-10-prompts-safety-checks-2024-01-13/Reuters世界中国
What might happen in Taiwan's election and what the outcome could meanPolls closed on Saturday for Taiwan's presidential and parliamentary elections. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 08:07:11 GMT MKLLGPPDQRJWZJJ44VNQEXQNFI https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/what-might-happen-taiwans-election-what-outcome-could-mean-2024-01-13/Reuters世界亚太地区
Tibetan issues not in focus, but repression persists - exiled former leaderThe plight of Tibet has become less discussed internationally but repression continues and China is applying what it did there to other regions, a former head of the Tibetan government-in-exile said on Saturday. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 07:22:27 GMT E2VHGST3EBMFBLI7KVZRJSGSVY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/tibetan-issues-not-focus-repression-persists-exiled-former-leader-2024-01-13/Reuters世界亚太地区
Tabilo gears up for Australian Open with Auckland triumphAlejandro Tabilo will head into the Australian Open on a high after winning his first ATP Tour title with a 6-2 7-5 victory over Japan's Taro Daniel in the Auckland Classic final on Saturday. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 03:28:01 GMT CWZ4I6223ZON7KTNOXPSOHXWDU https://www.reuters.com/sports/tennis/tabilo-gears-up-australian-open-with-auckland-triumph-2024-01-13/Reuters运动的网球
Taiwan detects two more Chinese balloons crossing straitTaiwan's defence ministry said on Saturday it had detected two Chinese balloons crossing the Taiwan Strait in the previous 24 hours, one of which flew over Taiwan island, the latest in a spate of balloon sightings the ministry has reported. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 01:09:25 GMT COXG33IFS5OLBPX5CPQF3547YI https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-detects-two-more-chinese-balloons-crossing-strait-2024-01-13/Reuters世界亚太地区
Blinken discusses human rights, Taiwan Strait with Chinese officialU.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Friday raised concerns over China's human rights issues in a meeting with senior Chinese official Liu Jianchao in Washington, the State Department said, adding they also discussed "maintaining peace and stability" in the Taiwan Strait. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 00:50:23 GMT 3EHDGKEU2JMPFHCTUW2UB4D7GY https://www.reuters.com/world/blinken-raises- human-rights-issues-meeting-with-senior-chinese-official-2024-01-13/Kanishka Singh世界
Taiwan ruling party's Lai takes initial lead in presidential voteLai Ching-te's Democratic Progressive Party champions Taiwan's separate identity and rejects China's territorial claims. Sat, 13 Jan 2024 00:06:20 GMT KNSNU4B6A5OSXG5Q63SITRAPWQ https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/polls-open-taiwans-ritic-elections-watched-closely-by-china-2024-01-13/Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard世界亚太地区
China urges better financing coordination for housing sectorChina's housing ministry and financial regulator asked local governments to better coordinate with financial institutions to provide financing support to real estate projects, as policymakers work to revive the sluggish housing market. China's 2023 bank lending at record high, but economy still strugglingNew bank lending in China rose less than expected in December, but 2023 lending hit a new record as the central bank kept policy accommodative to support an unexpectedly shaky economic recovery. Fri, 12 Jan 2024 11:26:26 GMT B26ZCDHZ3FKGTKLJVXURHTWL5Y https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/chinas-2023-bank-lending-record-high-economy-still-struggling-2024-01-12/Judy Hua, Kevin Yao市场亚洲市场
In moon race with China, U.S. setbacks test role of private firmsTwo U.S. setbacks this week in the race to the moon with China illustrate the risks of NASA's plans to bet on a new strategy of relying heavily on private companies. Weak demand, tighter lenders: Hong Kong property developers face tough 2024Hong Kong's property companies face a squeeze in 2024 from rising funding costs and sluggish home sales and office rentals, making creditors and investors cautious about developers’ financial health.
